body_html:
@byronyi , I did some test on benchmarks code using distributed_replicated mode and gpu as local_param_device.
I find sometimes I got 2017-07-31 17:09:05.880231: W tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/rdma.cc:129] No RDMA device found, maybe my ib driver has some problem.
I also got *** Error in `python3': free(): invalid pointer: 0x00007f47740066d0 *** sometimes, detail is on gist.
And my 1 worker to 4 workers speedup ratio is a little strange(small).
body_text:
@byronyi , I did some test on benchmarks code using distributed_replicated mode and gpu as local_param_device.
I find sometimes I got 2017-07-31 17:09:05.880231: W tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/rdma.cc:129] No RDMA device found, maybe my ib driver has some problem.
I also got *** Error in `python3': free(): invalid pointer: 0x00007f47740066d0 *** sometimes, detail is on gist.
And my 1 worker to 4 workers speedup ratio is a little strange(small).
body:
@byronyi , I did some test on benchmarks code using `distributed_replicated` mode and `gpu` as `local_param_device`.
I find sometimes I got ``` 2017-07-31 17:09:05.880231: W tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/rdma.cc:129] No RDMA device found ```, maybe my ib driver has some problem.
I also got ```*** Error in `python3': free(): invalid pointer: 0x00007f47740066d0 ***``` sometimes, detail is on [gist](https://gist.github.com/suiyuan2009/434b8abaf98ad9f81e39905df0a98db2).
And my 1 worker to 4 workers speedup ratio is a little strange(small).
